title: In a Hotel
summary: Vocabulary related to hotel accommodations, services, and common phrases used when staying at a hotel.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: In this Pre-intermediate Vocabulary Lesson about Hotels, you will learn the different types of rooms and accommodations available, what amenities and services you can expect, and useful verb phrases to use at a hotel. Check the pictures and read the definitions and examples below.

sections.heading: Types of rooms and accommodation
sections.content: Different room types and meal plan options available in hotels.

examples.definition: a room with a single bed for one person
examples.example: I stayed in a single room with just a narrow bed and a desk in it.

examples.definition: a room with a double bed for two people
examples.example: Lucy and Fred booked a double room with a huge bed in the middle of it.

examples.definition: a room with two single beds for two people
examples.example: The children slept in a twin room right next to their parents' room.

examples.definition: a room with a view of the sea
examples.example: I stayed in a big room with a sea view.

examples.definition: includes breakfast and one meal (usually dinner) in the room price
examples.example: We only booked half board because we wanted to try different places to eat.

examples.definition: includes all meals in the room price
examples.example: As we'd booked full board, we ate all our meals in the hotel restaurant.

sections.heading: Places and services in a hotel
sections.content: Common facilities and services offered by hotels.

examples.definition: the main desk where guests check in and get information
examples.example: I waited at the reception desk to ask for some information.

examples.definition: food and drinks delivered to your room
examples.example: It was too cold to go outside, so I called room service and ordered a sandwich.

examples.definition: room cleaning and maintenance service
examples.example: The housekeeping service was excellent, and the rooms were cleaned each day.

examples.definition: facility offering beauty treatments and relaxation services
examples.example: I spent an hour in the spa getting a relaxing massage.

examples.definition: large room for meetings and events
examples.example: The company had booked the conference room for their three-day national conference.

examples.definition: Wi-Fi connection available in the hotel
examples.example: I need a room with internet access, so that I can work and have video calls.

examples.definition: clothes washing service provided by the hotel
examples.example: I used the laundry service to have my shirt cleaned.

examples.definition: space available for guests to park their cars
examples.example: Unless the hotel has parking facilities, we won't be able to take the car.

examples.definition: phone call from reception to wake you at a specified time
examples.example: Tom requested a wake-up call for 7 am the next day.

sections.heading: Verb Phrases
sections.content: Common verbs and phrases used when staying at a hotel.

examples.definition: to reserve a hotel room
examples.example: I booked the room online as soon as I'd finished booking our flights.

examples.definition: to register your arrival at the hotel
examples.example: As soon as we arrived, we checked in at the reception desk.

examples.definition: to leave the hotel after paying your bill
examples.example: We were told we would have to check out of the hotel by 11:30 at the latest.

examples.definition: to settle your payment for the stay
examples.example: I paid the bill at the reception desk before leaving the hotel.

examples.definition: to ask for something politely
examples.example: Peter was feeling hungry, so he called the reception desk to request room service.
